sub_title: Translator-interpreter of English and just started as a mediator
summary:
Although I have been working as an interpreter-translator of English for more than 12 years, I still have the feeling that certain skills of mine are unutilized. My completed study of psychology refers to my interest in the human psyche. Also, the spiritual road I travelled, brought me to the insight that I am basically a bridge builder, i.e. a mediator. For that reason I started with a three-month course in mediation last year, which I completed properly and I also passed the subsequent theoretical test. What remains is the so-called assessment that I hope to pass within a year of practice with my intervision-group. As I think that, based upon my experience of life,  I should be able to mediate at this very moment, I offer here my services as a mediator for your conflicts or conflicts in which persons other than you are involved. I am a generalist. That is, I do not wish to limit myself to one specialty. I have the ability to read up thoroughly on any type of conflict. In the field of translations and, to an extent, interpreting, I always was a generalist as well, so I acquired this ability to read up on any type of subject in my 'first' profession. However, as I am not a registered mediator yet, I offer, except for your contribution of 50 euros, my mediation services to you on the basis of the WBA [= waardebepaling achteraf) principle (determining the value afterwards). After the mediation you yourself can determine the amount that you thought my services were worth, If your (native) language is English, no problem, because of my experience with the English language through my work as an interpreter-translator.

Of course, you can also call on me, when it comes to translation and interpreting work. In interpreting as a conversational and court interpreter I consider my sharp eye and ear for the non-verbal side of communication my surplus value, ensuring that the person 'interpreted' feels better understood, and, as a......
